sentences.sContent: The middle part of the bridge is supported by two huge towers.
sentences.sCn: 桥的中部由两个巨型桥塔支撑。

sentences.sContent: During sleep, our spine no longer needs to support the weight of our body.
sentences.sCn: 睡觉时，我们的脊柱不用再支撑体重。

sentences.sContent: ...He's cut back on medications and he no longer helps support his disabled mother...
...But finding hard evidence to support the thesis is not so easy...
...support and treatment for mental health issues...
...Those of us who are not scientists should also be prepared to support public engagement by scientists...
...Congress maintains subsidies for rich farmers as we cut back on nutritional support for the needy...
...she is setting up one of 1100 action groups with the support of Climate Solidarity...
...There is a lot of support at Yale...
...Some top institutions like Yale seem to provide first-generation students with more support than they actually need...
...and professors who all provided significant support for students who lacked confidence about "belonging" at such a top institution...
...Our support structure was more like: You are going to get through Yale...

synos.tran: [医][机]支持，支撑，[计][军]支援；扶持，帮助；[法]赡养，供养
[医][机]支持，维持；[计][军]支援，供养；支持者，支撑物

phrases.pCn: 决策支持系统；判定支援系统
支持团队；（英国地方教育当局任命的）流动代课教师组
支援团；摇滚音乐会的配角乐团

words.tran: 支持的；辅助性的；次要的
可支持的；可援助的；可忍耐的

trans.tranOther: to hold the weight of something, keep it in place, or prevent it from falling
